intro: Llagunoa glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular llagunoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, tropical or subtropical environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
